result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J Niergarth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-------------------------------

Pay court costs.   ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS HAVE BEEN PAID IN FULL.  
-------------------------------

supervisions.notes: **04/30/2015 AMENDMENT:  The term of probation on Count #2 is Amended from Three (3) years to One (1) year.

Competency Report

Defendant Patrick J Niergarth in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court grants request to continue this matter and orders updated competency exam. Minutes filed.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Patrick J Niergarth in court, in custody with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Valerian A. Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant disagrees with Doctor's finding regarding competency and requests a hearing. Minutes filed.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.
Order for Competency Report

Total Bond: 14GF547 (SO# 14-2505, 14-2506, 14-2507) and 14CF107 and 14CF63.   Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH DETECTIVE D.S. OR HIS RESIDENCE. NO CONTACT WITH SPEEDWAY IN DELAVAN.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Patrick J Niergarth, in custody, by video, with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. A competency evaluation was done on Mr. Niergarth in file 2014CF000063.  The Court finds there is probable cause to doubt Mr. Niergarth's competency to proceed in this case also.  Mr. Niergarth disagrees with the findings of the Report.  Court sets matter for a competency hearing with the Defendant's other file.  MInutes filed.  Competency hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
